entries.name: Arcane Jewels
entries: 奥术宝石是珍贵的宝石（如蓝宝石、红宝石或翡翠），经过巫师或工匠精心切割、塑形和刻上魔法符文制成。
这些宝石可以插入一件非魔法（或精工）的轻甲、中甲或重甲。

entries.name: Arcane Jewels
entries: 奥术宝石是珍贵的宝石（如蓝宝石、红宝石或翡翠），经过巫师或工匠精心切割、塑形和刻上魔法符文制成。
这些宝石可以镶嵌到非魔法（或精良）武器中。

data.name: Arcane Jewels
entries: {@homebrew This is only chapter 15 of {@link Darker Dungeon|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ufAyAnP4YTyJmOvyFQwnJZoTMTe95ETt/view} 由吉菲格利夫（Giffyglyph）创作。
你所使用的武器和穿戴的盔甲都能反映出你的角色特点。但当你最喜爱的装备开始失去优势时，你会怎么做呢？
拥有合适的工具和训练，你就不必放弃你喜爱的物品。在冒险中找到奥术宝石，并将它们插入你的物品中，以赋予它们新的魔法能力，提升它们的力量。
本章介绍了奥术宝石以及如何在你的冒险中加入它们的规则。

data.name: Jewels
entries: 奥术宝石是珍贵的宝石（如蓝宝石、红宝石或翡翠），经过巫师或工匠精心切割、塑形和刻上魔法符文制成。
当一个奥术宝石被插入武器或护甲中时，该物品会被赋予永久的魔法力量 — 一种新的伤害类型，元素抗性，提高的命中率，一个新的法术等。
奥术宝石充满了魔力 — 将你的平凡武器和基础盔甲转化为魔法定制品。

entries.name: Socketing a Jewel
entries: 要使用一颗奥术宝石，你必须将其插入一件装备中。这个过程分为三个步骤：

items: {@b Pick an Item:} 选择a)一件武器或b)一件轻甲、中甲或重甲。你的物品必须同时a)非魔法的，b)目前插槽宝石少于三颗。
{@b Pick a Jewel:} 选择一个适合你物品的珠宝。你不能在同一物品上插入相同类型的珠宝 — 所以要谨慎选择。
{@b Use your Tools:}花费一个小时和一套工匠工具（或其他适合你物品的工具——铁匠工具、织工工具等）来镶嵌你的宝石。你必须精通你的工具才能做到这一点。

entries: Krazak有一个{@item Lucent Jewel of Immolation|JWL}，想要将它插入他的非魔法巨斧中。他花了一个小时用他的{@item smith's tools|PHB}来安装这颗宝石。
当你将一颗奥术宝石插入物品时，该宝石在你调谐该物品之前不会提供任何魔法效益。
Krazak的巨斧在他与之相符后仍然是非魔法的 - 此时插入的宝石会闪耀起来，武器变成了魔法的。
后来，克拉扎克找到了第二颗宝石 — 一颗{@item Royal Jewel of Elements (Fire)|JWL}。他想要镶嵌它，但在武器是魔法的情况下无法这样做。他结束了对巨斧的调谐 — 这将武器恢复到非魔法状态，并使他能够镶嵌新的宝石。

entries.name: Removing a Socketed Jewel
entries: 一旦一颗宝石被插入，它就成为物品的固有部分。要移除一个插入的宝石，你必须花费八个小时使用适当的工具。一旦你移除了一个插入的宝石，这颗宝石就可以被重新使用。
另外，您也可以花费一小时直接摧毁一个插槽宝石。这会将宝石从物品中移除，但会让它变得毫无价值 — 该宝石无法再次使用。
Krazak从一只红龙的藏宝中找到了一个{@item Astral Jewel of Elements (Fire)|JWL}。为了将其插入他的巨斧中，他必须先移除当前插入的{@item Royal Jewel of Elements (Fire)|JWL}。
在卡拉顿城市里闲暇时光里，克拉扎克花了八个小时，{@item smith's tools|PHB}小心地从他的巨斧上取下皇家宝石。

entries.name: Masterwork Items
entries: 一个没有其他增强或特殊功能的魔法+1/+2/+3武器或护甲被视为一个{@i masterwork}物品。
您可以像平常一样将珠宝插入精制物品中，将它们视为非魔法物品。
Chansi有一件杰作{@item +1 Longbow|DMG|+1 bow}。这弓没有其他魔法特性，她可以将一个{@item Lucent Jewel of Frost|JWL|Lucent Jewel of Freezing}插入武器中。
与此同时，翠绿（Viridian）拥有一件 {@item Glamoured Studded Leather|DMG} 护甲。这件 +1 护甲具有额外的魔法特性——幻化——因此无法插槽。

entries.name: Casting a Jeweled Spell
entries: 一些宝石 — 例如 {@item royal jewel of spellbinding|JWL|Jewels of Spellbinding} — 可以储存一个法术，并允许您在以后的某个日期施放它。当您施放一个嵌宝石的法术时，以下特性适用：

items: {@b Command Word:} 你必须说出一个口令来激活这个宝石法术。
{@b Spell Slots:} 当你从宝石中施放咒语时，不消耗任何法术位。
{@b Class Restrictions:}即使你不是自然施法者，你也可以施放这个法术。
{@b Components:} 你可以忽略任何未计算成本的法术组件（口头、手势和物质）。
{@b Saving Throws:} 如果你的法术需要目标进行豁免检定，豁免 DC 取决于你的宝石的品质 — 皇家 (DC 13)，明亮 (DC 15) 和星体 (DC 18)。

entries: 维里迪安(Viridian)，一名魅魔吟游诗人，身上镶嵌着一个{@item Lucent Jewel of Spellbinding|JWL} ({@spell Burning Hands})。
在他的回合中，他说出一个命令词来激活这颗宝石，然后花费1个奖励动作施放一个1级{@spell Burning Hands}法术。

entries.name: Jewel Charges
entries: 充能宝石在用几次后就会耗尽魔力变得休眠。
要消耗一个充能，你必须说出一个指令词。宝石必须插入一个已调谐的物品中，你必须穿戴或持有该物品才能发出指令。
{@b Choosing your Command Words:} 当你将一颗宝石插入物品时，你可以决定它的口令是什么。这将覆盖之前分配给宝石的任何口令。
{@b Recovering Charges:} 当一个镶嵌在一个已调谐物品上的宝石，当它的所有者完成一次长休后，会恢复所有已消耗的充能。

data.name: Jewelcrafting
entries: 在你的冒险中，你可能会发现特别高质量的宝石 — {@item royal ruby|JWL|royal gemstones}、{@item lucent ruby|JWL|lucent gemstones} 和 {@item astral ruby|JWL|astral gemstones} 石头。
如果你精通于a) {@skill Arcana}和b) {@item jeweler's tools|PHB}，你可以用这些切割好的宝石制作自己的奥术宝石。需要遵循三个步骤：

entries.name: 1 Pick a Jewel Recipe
entries: 首先，你需要获取与你的珠宝相关的制作配方。每颗珠宝都需要特定类型的宝石，如配方所述。

entries.name: 2 Get a Gemstone
entries: 接下来，你必须获得一颗合适的宝石。一颗奥术宝石需要特定类型和质量的宝石 — 为你打算制作的宝石选择正确的石头。
你的宝石必须是a) 切割过的，并且b) 在质量上是 {@item royal ruby|JWL|royal gemstones}，{@item lucent ruby|JWL|lucent gemstones}，或者{@item astral ruby|JWL|astral gemstones}（由你的珠宝所指定）。

entries.name: 3 Craft the Jewel
entries: 用{@item jeweler's tools|PHB}小心工作8小时，将切割后的宝石打造成珠宝。然后，你可以进行一个智力检定({@skill Arcana})，检定结果决定你的宝石质量：皇家级(DC 15)、透亮级(DC 20)或星界级(DC 25)。

items: {@b Critical Success (+10 or more):} 你制作了一颗奥术宝石，并回收了少量宝石粉末。这些粉末可以作为以下属性的制作材料：
{@b Rarity:} 稀有 (Royal), 非常稀有 (Lucent), 或 传奇 (Astral)
{@b Element:} 选择一个适合你的宝石
{@b Success:} You crafted an arcane jewel. It holds magical energy and is now ready to be socketed.
{@b Failure:} You cracked the gemstone — it can't be turned into a jewel, potion, or oil.
{@b Critical Failure (-10 or more):} You've made a huge mistake — the gemstone cracks and its quality is reduced by one step.

entries.name: Crafting Details
entries: Some jewels require you to choose a specific detail — such as a spell, skill, or saving throw. Once you finish crafting your jewel, this detail can't be changed — a Royal Jewel of Skill ({@skill Acrobatics}) will forever be that — so choose your spells and skills wisely.

Imprinting a Spell: To imprint a spell into a jewel (such as a {@item royal jewel of spellbinding|JWL|Jewel of Spellbinding}), you must a) be able to cast the spell yourself and b) have the spell prepared. You can't imprint any spell that requires concentration or costed material components (unless specified otherwise).
Viridian wants to craft a {@item Royal Jewel of Spellbinding|JWL} ({@spell Healing Word}) for his armor — in case of emergencies.

To hold a 1st-level spell, Viridian buys a cut, {@item royal quartz|JWL}. He spends a day crafting the jewel and makes a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check — he rolls a 17, successfully creating a Royal Jewel of Healing Word.

data.name: Jewel Recipes
entries: There are 32 common arcane jewels that can be crafted for your weapons and armor. Use these recipes to create your jewels and empower your equipment.
Some jewels derive their damage type (fire, cold, etc.) from their gemstone. There are 10 known elemental gemstones:

entries.name: Armor Jewels
entries: 这些宝石可以插入一件非魔法（或精工）的轻甲、中甲或重甲。
{@b GM:} The drunk ogre kicks out at you, Ulryn, knocking you back 5 ft — right over the edge of the bridge.
{@b Ulryn:} Tsk tsk — you can't move the mountain, my friend. I flare my {@item Lucent Jewel of Grounding|JWL} and stay exactly where I am...

entries.name: Weapon Jewels
entries: 这些宝石可以镶嵌到非魔法（或精良）武器中。
The {@creature troll} laughed at the wound torn open on its chest. 'Stupid dwarf, you can't kill me — you have no fire.'
Krazak grinned, pointing at the {@item Lucent Jewel of Decay|JWL|black jewel} socketed into his greataxe. The troll's laughter turned to howls of pain as its body disintegrated from within.

As Chansi socketed the {@item Astral Jewel of Transmutation (Lightning)|JWL|topaz jewel} into her bow, electric lines of power spread throughout the wood and down the bowstring. She nocked an arrow — it crackled with bolts of lightning. Chansi grinned...

data.name: Mythic Jewels
entries: Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers. These jewels can't be crafted by normal means, but — if found — can be socketed into your weapons and armor.
{@b GM:} Inside the artificer's safe, you find a single jewel hidden amongst the scattered papers. You recognize it, Silva — it's a {@item Jewel of Quickload|JWL}.
{@b Silva:} Oh my stars, finally! I know {@i exactly} which thunder cannon we're going to socket you into....

data.name: Variant Dials
entries: If you want to customize Arcane Jewels to better fit your game, consider some of the following variant dials.

entries.name: Artificer's Craft
entries: If you want to make artificers more significant in crafting socketed gear, consider using Artificer's Craft.
{@b Tool Expertise:} While socketing or crafting a jewel, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.
{@b Critical Failure:} If you critically fail while socketing or crafting a jewel, you may treat it as a normal failure.
Silva, a human artificer, is crafting a {@item Lucent Jewel of Accuracy|JWL}. She makes a critical error — but her artificer's knowledge enables her to salvage the gemstone.

entries.name: Permanent Jewels
entries: If you want to make arcane jewels a more considered choice for your players, try using Permanent Jewels.
Once a jewel is socketed into a weapon or piece of armor, it is permanently fixed — you can't unsocket or shatter a socketed jewel.

entries.name: Gemstone Rarity
entries: If you want to make magical gemstones harder to find in your campaign, try using Gemstone Rarity.
Gemstones — especially those of royal, lucent, and astral quality — are rare and hard (if not impossible) to buy.

entries.name: Runes & Enchantments
entries: Jewels may not be the best fit for your campaign. If so, consider reflavoring them into Runes or Enchantments.

{@b Runes:} Magic runes are carved into small stones and set with precious gemstone dust. Turn your royal, lucent, and astral gemstones into powerful arcane runes and socket them into your weapons and armor.
Arcane runes can be socketed and unsocketed in the same fashion as arcane jewels.

{@b Enchantments:} Magic enchantments are cast using gemstone dust as a component. Turn your royal, lucent, and astral gemstones into powerful arcane enchantments and weave them over your weapons and armor.
To successfully enchant an item, you must make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check against the quality of the gemstone: royal (DC 10), lucent (DC 15), or astral (DC 20).

To cast an {@item Astral Jewel of Elements (Fire)|JWL|Astral Enchantment of Elements (Fire)} on Krazak's greataxe, Clanda grinds an astral gemstone into dust and — to perform the enchantment — makes an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check against DC 20...

entries.name: Risky Unsocketing
entries: If you want to make unsocketing a little more dangerous for your players, try using Risky Unsocketing.

To unsocket a jewel from an item, make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check (using a set of appropriate crafting tools) against the quality of the gemstone: royal (DC 10), lucent (DC 15), or astral (DC 20). If you succeed, the jewel is removed and can be reused — if you fail, the jewel shatters in your hands.

entries.name: Rare Recipes
entries: Depending on your campaign setting, you may wish to restrict the knowledge of jewelcrafting to a few particular races, factions, or cultures.
Jewel recipes can be an easy way to add some flavor to your world or generate friction between factions.
A GM wants to add arcane jewels to their game world. They rule that only the dwarves and gnomes of the Western Dominance have the knowledge to craft jewels — knowledge that is well guarded.
Some people would pay handsomely for one of the dwarvish books of jewelcrafting, should any light-fingered adventurer be willing...

entries.name: Mentors
entries: A jewelcraft mentor — such as a jeweler or artificer — can teach you how to craft new jewels. A mentor knows the crafting recipes for three random gemstones. It takes (10 - INT) days to learn a recipe from a mentor.

entries.name: Recipe Books
entries: A jewelcrafting book can teach you how to craft new jewels. You can buy these from artificers and jewelcrafters, or find them scattered throughout the world.
A recipe book holds the crafting recipes for three jewels, and can cost upwards of 1,500 gp. It takes (10 - INT) days to learn a new recipe from the book.
Viridian is trying to learn how to craft some armor jewels. To expand his collection of jewel recipes, he buys a {@item Recipe Book (Jewels)|JWL|jewelcrafting book} from a local artificer...

item.name: Recipe Book (Jewels)
entries: This book contains jewel-crafting recipes for {@item Royal Jewel of Absorption|JWL|absorption}, {@item Lucent Jewel of Resistance (Fire)|JWL|resistance}, and {@item Astral Jewel of Spellbinding|JWL|spellbinding} jewels.

item.name: Royal Jewel of Absorption
entries: {@i Garnet with rare sparkles of light.}
Reduce any bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from non-magical weapons by 1, to a minimum of 1.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Absorption
entries: {@i Garnet with persistent sparkles of light.}
Reduce any bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from non-magical weapons by 2, to a minimum of 1.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Absorption
entries: {@i Garnet with a persistent, inner glow.}
Reduce any bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from non-magical weapons by 3, to a minimum of 1.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Capacity
entries: {@i Opal with persistent sparkles of light.}
You count as one size category larger when determining your carrying capacity.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Capacity
entries: {@i Opal with a persistent, inner glow.}
You count as one size category larger when determining your carrying capacity.
In addition to your carrying capacity, you count as one size category larger when determining the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Grounding
entries: {@i Opal with persistent sparkles of light.}
When you are forcibly moved against your will, you can spend your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 5 ft.
You must remain in contact with the ground during this movement.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Grounding
entries: {@i Opal with a persistent, inner glow.}
When you are forcibly moved against your will, you can spend your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 ft.
You must remain in contact with the ground during this movement.

item.name: Royal Jewel of Luck
entries: {@i Pearl with rare sparkles of light.}
When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can spend 1 charge to reroll 1 {@dice d20}. You must accept the second result.

item.name: Royal Jewel of Speed
entries: {@i Jet with rare sparkles of light.}
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to gain a +5 ft bonus to your maximum speed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Speed
entries: {@i Jet with persistent sparkles of light.}
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to gain a +10 ft bonus to your maximum speed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Speed
entries: {@i Jet with a persistent, inner glow.}
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to gain a +15 ft bonus to your maximum speed. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

item.name: Royal Jewel of Spellbinding
entries: {@i Quartz with rare sparkles of light.}
This jewel holds an imprint of 1st-level spell. During your turn, you can spend 1 charge to cast the spell imprinted into this jewel.
{@note May not contain a spell that requires concentration or costed material. You may ignore all spell components, the attack bonus is +5 and if a saving throw is required, its DC is 13}

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Spellbinding
entries: {@i Quartz with persistent sparkles of light.}
This jewel holds an imprint of 2nd-level spell. During your turn, you can spend 1 charge to cast the spell imprinted into this jewel.
{@note May not contain a spell that requires concentration or costed material. You may ignore all spell components, the attack bonus is +7 and if a saving throw is required, its DC is 15}

item.name: Astral Jewel of Spellbinding
entries: {@i Quartz with a persistent, inner glow.}
This jewel holds an imprint of 3rd-level spell. During your turn, you can spend 1 charge to cast the spell imprinted into this jewel.
{@note May not contain a spell that requires concentration or costed material. You may ignore all spell components, the attack bonus is +10 and if a saving throw is required, its DC is 18}

item.name: Astral Jewel of Spellpower

item.name: Astral Jewel of Vigor

item.name: Royal Jewel of Bane
entries: {@i Emerald with rare sparkles of light.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d6} additional poison damage.
The target must then make a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) — if it fails, the target is {@condition Poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

entries: {@i Emerald with persistent sparkles of light.}

item.name: Royal Jewel of Frost
entries: {@i Sapphire with rare sparkles of light.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d6} additional cold damage.

The target must then make a Strength saving throw (DC 13) — if it fails, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. The target can spend an action and make a Strength saving throw (DC 13) to attempt to break free of the frost during its turn.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Frost
entries: {@i Sapphire with persistent sparkles of light.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d8} additional cold damage.

The target must then make a Strength saving throw (DC 15) — if it fails, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. The target can spend an action and make a Strength saving throw (DC 15) to attempt to break free of the frost during its turn.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Frost
entries: {@i Sapphire with a persistent, inner glow.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d10} additional cold damage.

The target must then make a Strength saving throw (DC 18) — if it fails, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. The target can spend an action and make a Strength saving throw (DC 18) to attempt to break free of the frost during its turn.

item.name: Royal Jewel of Immolation
entries: {@i Ruby with rare sparkles of light.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d6} additional fire damage.

The target is then afflicted with burning flames. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) — if it fails, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. The effect ends when either a) the target makes a successful saving throw against it or b) one minute has passed.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Immolation
entries: {@i Ruby with persistent sparkles of light.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d8} additional fire damage.

The target is then afflicted with burning flames. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 15) — if it fails, the target takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage. The effect ends when either a) the target makes a successful saving throw against it or b) one minute has passed.

item.name: Astral Jewel of Immolation
entries: {@i Ruby with a persistent, inner glow.}
Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d10} additional fire damage.

The target is then afflicted with burning flames. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 18) — if it fails, the target takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage. The effect ends when either a) the target makes a successful saving throw against it or b) one minute has passed.

item.name: Lucent Jewel of Opportunity
entries: {@i Jet with persistent sparkles of light.}
You can spend 1 charge to make one opportunity attack using this weapon as a free action. If you hit a target with this attack, its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d10} additional psychic damage. The target must then make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 18) — if it fails, the target is {@condition Frightened} until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Jewel of Feint
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}
When a creature that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can spend 1 charge to force that creature to reroll the attack. It must use the second result.

item.name: Jewel of the Giantslayer
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

item.name: Jewel of Quickload
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

item.name: Jewel of Relocate
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d10} additional force damage. The target must make a Charisma saving throw (DC 18) — if it fails, you swap places with it. The target must be able to fit comfortably into your space, and must be within 100 ft of you.

item.name: Jewel of Spectral Shot
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

This weapon can now fire spectral ammunition (arrows/bolts/bullets/etc) instead of normal ammunition. Spectral ammunition counts as magical damage. This jewel has no effect if socketed into a weapon that uses no ammunition.

item.name: Jewel of the Undeadslayer
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}

item.name: Jewel of Free Movement
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to ignore the movement penalty from {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.
{@homebrew This jewel was added by the converter.}

item.name: Jewel of Blood
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}
If you reduce a creature that isn't a constructs or undead to 0 hit points with an attack using this weapon, you gain {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points.
{@homebrew This jewel was added by the converter.}

item.name: Jewel of the Sun
entries: {@i Mythic jewels are a rarity in the world, hidden in treasure hoards and coveted by powerful adventurers.}
The weapon emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. You can use a bonus action to make the light disappear.
{@homebrew This jewel was added by the converter.}

table.name: Mythic Armor Jewels
table.caption: Mythic Armor Jewels table
rows: You have proficiency with this armor.
You have a swim speed equal to your normal speed, and you can breathe underwater.
Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 charge to be reduced to 1 hit point instead.
Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
As a bonus action, spend 1 charge to become invisible until the end of your next turn.
You have proficiency in one skill (as determined by the jewel).
This armor no longer imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.
You can try to hide while lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.
Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge and summon your armor. The armor must be within 100 ft of you, and you must be able to wear it comfortably.
You can read, write, and speak one language (as determined by the jewel).
You can walk across water. If you end your movement on water, you fall into it as normal.
Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
{@homebrew You descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.}

{@homebrew As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to regain hit points equal to your constitution modifier, minimum of 1, at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, provided that you have at least 1 hit point.}
{@homebrew As a bonus action, you can spend 1 charge to ignore the movement penalty from {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.}

table.name: Mythic Weapon Jewels
table.caption: Mythic Weapon Jewels table
rows: This weapon critically hits a target on a natural 19-20.
When you hit a target with this weapon, that target can't regenerate hit points or be healed by a magical spell or effect until the end of its next turn.
When you hit a demon with this weapon, you deal an additional 2d6 weapon damage.
When you hit a devil with this weapon, you deal an additional 2d6 weapon damage.
When you hit a dragon with this weapon, you deal an additional 3d6 weapon damage.

Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal 1d10 additional psychic damage. The target must then make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 18)—if it fails, the target is Frightened until the end of its next turn.
When a creature that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can spend 1 charge to force that creature to reroll the attack. It must use the second result.
When you hit a giant with this weapon, you deal an additional 2d6 weapon damage.

Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal 1d10 additional lightning damage. The target must then make a Constitution saving throw (DC 18)—if it fails, the target is Paralyzed until the end of its next turn.
This weapon no longer has the Loading property.

Once per turn, when you hit a target with this weapon, you can spend 1 charge to deal 1d10 additional force damage. The target must make a Charisma saving throw (DC 18)—if it fails, you swap places with it. The target must be able to fit comfortably into your space, and must be within 100 ft of you.

This weapon can now fire spectral ammunition (arrows/bolts/bullets/etc) instead of normal ammunition. Spectral ammunition counts as magical damage. This jewel has no effect if socketed into a weapon that uses no ammunition.
When you hit an undead creature with this weapon, you deal an additional 1d6 damage.
When you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can make one attack using this weapon as a bonus action.
You have proficiency with this weapon.
{@homebrew If you reduce a creature that isn't a constructs or undead to 0 hit points with an attack using this weapon, you gain 1d6 temporary hit points.}
{@homebrew The weapon emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. You can use a bonus action to make the light disappear.}
